Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory759.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: '...Operation data cracked!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The flying fortresses on the outer circle slowly come to a stop, following the heavy roars of machines and the grinding of gears, forming a weird shape around the central flying fortress.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I cracked Utopia's central control system using the encryption key I got from Asimov and locked all the smaller flying fortresses around the central flying fortress...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: '...So that wherever we happen to be after breaking through our current location, we can make a beeline straight into the central flying fortress.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Let's keep heading toward the central flying fortress.", 3: '9'}
{3: 'Based on her current location, Echo appears to be in one of the smaller flying fortresses around here.'}
{3: 'You keep your fingers crossed, hoping to reach her in time.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory761.jpg'}
{3: "In one of Utopia's smaller flying fortresses."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Keeping herself hidden in a dark corner, Echo gulps for air.'}
{3: 'Utopia... is so big.'}
{3: 'Countless flying vessels gather and reassemble around Utopia. Echo has tried and tried again to brute-force her way through—only to see more enemies behind the door every time she opens one.'}
{3: "The armor seems dejected as well. From behind Echo, she puts a hand gently on Echo's shoulder."}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Cecily, we aren't quite there yet.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Echo knows she can't stop just yet—not when they're all in this together."}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "I'm sure we'll get him somewhere. Like... how the sun always shows itself after the darkest hours.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As Echo tries to figure out how to reserve her energy, the deck suddenly starts shaking.'}
{3: "Commotion fills the air. The majority of the Aurora Squadron doesn't seem to know what just happened."}
{3: "Echo's eyes shine brightly."}
{3: 'She knows her trust has paid off, in the best way possible.'}
{3: 'The commandant has cracked the data Echo herself had trusted the Gray Raven with and controlled these smaller flying fortresses with the encryption key in it.'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "...It's about time.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Echo', 3: 'Do you need a few more minutes before we go, Cecily?', 4: '1'}
{3: "The armor touches Echo's forehead gently as if talking to her in silence."}
{2: 'Echo', 3: "Well... let's get going, then.", 4: '1'}
{3: "She's thoroughly exhausted—but her eyes are glimmering with light, redolent of the stars in the galaxy."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory760.jpg'}
{1: 'Utopia', 2: 'Control Room'}
{3: "In Utopia's Control Room."}
{1: '1', 3: "Pickman squints his eyes in appreciation of the test subject in front of him, while the researcher beside him wastes no time recording what's happening."}
{3: 'As the red progress bar slowly fills the gray space, the Construct in the vessel falls quiet after a violet struggle.'}
{2: 'Utopia Researcher', 3: 'Rejection reaction detected. Remaining consciousness about 62.15%.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Pickman', 3: "That's good enough.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Pickman', 3: 'How many samples do we have left?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Utopia Researcher', 3: 'Three.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Pickman', 3: "That won't do... We're still missing the most important one...", 4: '1'}
{3: '...A leader.'}

{3: 'At best, the end product could be nothing more than a huge and orderly mess without a "leader" to hold the consciousnesses together. It\'s only when there is a "leader"—one that is stable and firm itself—leading them that they come to make contact with that greater power.'}
{2: 'Pickman', 3: 'What a shame...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He shakes his head as he casts a look at the screen next to him, which is now showing Echo fighting alongside the armor.'}
{2: 'Pickman', 3: 'Alisa and Cecily... either one of you has what it takes to put this experiment to a perfect end...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Pickman', 3: '...Which is not necessarily a bad thing.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Pickman breaks into a smile.'}
{2: 'Pickman', 3: "Never thought I'd ever need to use Plan B, but...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Slowly, Pickman removes his gloves.'}
